sections.heading:
SERI PAHLAWAN GAGAH PERKASA (REMEMBRANCE 
ALLOWANCE) ACT 1990
sections.content:
SERI PAHLAWAN GAGAH PERKASA (REMEMBRANCE 
ALLOWANCE) ACT 1990

An  Act  to  provide  for  the  grant  of  a  remembrance  allowance  to  the 
recipients of the Decoration of Seri Pahlawan Gagah Perkasa and for 
matters connected therewith.

BE  IT  ENACTED  by  the  Seri  Paduka  Baginda  Yang  di-Pertuan 
Agong with the advice and consent of the Dewan Negara and Dewan 
Rakyat in Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as 
follows:
Short title

sections.heading:
1.  This  Act  may  be  cited  as  the  Seri  Pahlawan  Gagah  Perkasa 
(Remembrance Allowance) Act 1990.
sections.content:
1.  This  Act  may  be  cited  as  the  Seri  Pahlawan  Gagah  Perkasa 
(Remembrance Allowance) Act 1990.
Interpretation

sections.heading: 2.   In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—
sections.content: 2.   In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—
“child” includes a stepchild and a child adopted, before the death of
the recipient, under any written law, custom or usage;
“Minister” means the Prime Minister;
6                                   Laws of Malaysia                              ACT 439
“recipient”  means  any  person  who  has  been  conferred  the
Decoration;
“remembrance  allowance”  means  the  remembrance  allowance
granted under subsection 3(1);

“spouse”  means  the  widow  or  widower  of  a  deceased  recipient 
whose marriage is recognized in Malaysia as a valid marriage under 
any written law, religion, custom or usage.
Grant of remembrance allowance

*3. (1) There may be granted to a recipient a remembrance allowance 
of  four  hundred  ringgit  per  month,  and  where  the  Decoration  is 
conferred on such recipient more than once, there may be granted to 
him  a  separate  remembrance  allowance  of  four  hundred  ringgit  per 
month  in  respect  of  each  Decoration  conferred  on  him,  such 
allowance  being  payable  in  arrear  not  earlier  than  the  end  of  each 
month.
(2)  Where
the  Decoration  was  conferred  before

the 
commencement  of  this  Act  and  the  recipient  is  living  upon  such 
commencement, 
shall  be  paid 
retrospectively to the recipient, commencing with the month in which 
the  Decoration  was  conferred  on  him,  but  not  earlier,  in  any  case, 
than the month of June 1983.
remembrance  allowance
the

(3)   Where the Decoration is conferred after the commencement 
of this Act, the remembrance allowance shall be paid to the recipient 
monthly  in  arrear,  commencing  with  the  month  in  which  the 
Decoration is conferred on him.
Cessation of grant of remembrance allowance

sections.heading: 4.  (1)   The grant of a remembrance allowance shall cease—
sections.content: 4.  (1)   The grant of a remembrance allowance shall cease—

*NOTE—See sections 4 and 5 of Act A1136 for computation and manner of payment and grant 
to next of kin of recipient who had died before commencement of Act.
Seri Pahlawan Gagah Pekasa (Remembrance Allowance)        7
(a) upon the death of the recipient;

(b) upon  the  recipient  being  convicted  for  an  offence  by  a 
court of law in  the  Federation and sentenced to  death,  or 
than 
any 
to 
imprisonment in lieu of payment of fine; or
term  otherwise
imprisonment
for

(c)  upon cancellation or annullment of the conferment of the 
Decoration in accordance with section VIII of the Statutes 
of Seri Pahlawan Gagah Perkasa,

and  no  remembrance  allowance  shall  be  paid  commencing  with  the 
month in which the death takes place, or the sentence is imposed, or 
the conferment of the Decoration is cancelled or annulled, as the case 
may be.

(1A)  For the purposes of subsection (1), the month in which the 
sentence  is  imposed  means  the  month  in  which  such  sentence  is 
pronounced  by  the  trial  court  or  if  there  is  an  appeal  against  such 
sentence  the  month  in  which  such  sentence  is  confirmed  on  such 
appeal.

(2)   If the recipient receives a free pardon in respect of the said 
conviction,  or  if  the  cancelled  or  annulled  Decoration  is  restored  to 
him, 
to  him 
commencing from the month in which the free pardon is received or 
the restoration of the Decoration is made.
the  remembrance  allowance  shall  be  restored

Grant  to  next  of  kin  of  recipient  where  Decoration  conferred 
posthumously

sections.heading:
5.  (1)  Where  the  Decoration  had  been  conferred  posthumously 
before the commencement of this Act, there may be made a grant of a 
total sum of twenty thousand ringgit once only—
sections.content:
5.  (1)  Where  the  Decoration  had  been  conferred  posthumously 
before the commencement of this Act, there may be made a grant of a 
total sum of twenty thousand ringgit once only—
8                                   Laws of Malaysia                              ACT 439
(b) if there is on such date no such spouse or child living, to his
parents or parent living on such date; or
(c)  if  there  is  on  such  date  no  such  parent  living,  to  his
grandparents or grandparent living on such date.

(2)  Where  the  Decoration  is  conferred  posthumously  after  the 
commencement of this Act, there may be made a grant of a total sum 
of twenty thousand ringgit once only—
(b) if there is on such date no such spouse or child living, to
his parents or parent living on such date; or
(c)  if  there  is  on  such  date  no  parent  living,  to  his
grandparents or grandparent living on such date.

Grant  to  next  of  kin  of  recipient  who  had  died  before 
commencement of Act

6.   Where  the  Decoration  was  conferred  before  the  commencement 
of  this  Act  and  the  recipient  had  died  before  such  commencement, 
there may be made a grant of a total sum of twenty thousand ringgit 
once only—
(b) if there is on such date no such spouse or child living, to his
parents or parent living on such date; or
(c)  if  there  is  on  such  date  no  such  parent  living,  to  his
grandparents or grandparent living on such date.
Seri Pahlawan Gagah Pekasa (Remembrance Allowance)        9
Minister to apportion amounts to be paid

sections.heading:
7.   The amounts to be paid to the spouse or spouses, children, parents 
or grandparents, as the case may be, under section 5 or 6 shall be in 
such proportions as may be determined by the Minister.
sections.content:
7.   The amounts to be paid to the spouse or spouses, children, parents 
or grandparents, as the case may be, under section 5 or 6 shall be in 
such proportions as may be determined by the Minister.

Remembrance  allowance  and  sum  to  be  charged  on  Federal 
Consolidated Fund

sections.heading:
8.   The  remembrance  allowances  and  sums  granted  under  this  Act 
shall be charged on the Federal Consolidated Fund.
sections.content:
8.   The  remembrance  allowances  and  sums  granted  under  this  Act 
shall be charged on the Federal Consolidated Fund.
Remembrance allowance and sum not assignable, etc.

sections.heading:
9.   Any remembrance allowance or sum granted under this Act shall 
not be assignable or transferable, or liable to be attached, sequestrated 
or levied upon in respect of any claim.
sections.content:
9.   Any remembrance allowance or sum granted under this Act shall 
not be assignable or transferable, or liable to be attached, sequestrated 
or levied upon in respect of any claim.
